wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Gadd Matthews (9 December 1845 at Clifton, Bristol – 5 January 1932 at Newport Towers, Gloucestershire) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1870 to 1878 for Gloucestershire, making 29 appearances.  A right-handed batsman (RHB), he scored 769 runs with a highest score of 201.  He made one century, 2 half-centuries and held 13 catches.

response: *Thomas Matthews (table tennis) (born 1992), British Paralympic table tennis player
*Thomas Matthews (Dexter), a character in the American television drama series Dexter

link_mentions.page: W. G. Grace in the 1878 English cricket season
response: Gloucestershire arrived shorthanded at The Oval on 20 June. Their regular players present were the three Grace brothers, their cousin Walter Gilbert, wicket-keeper James Bush and batsmen James Cranston and Thomas Matthews. They also had the inexperienced William Woof, Carleton Haynes and Edward Wright, all of whom made their first-class debuts against Surrey. That was ten, so another player had to be found and Grace decided to take action.
